meanings.definition: Suitable for sailing in various weather conditions.
meanings.sent1: The weatherly ship easily navigated through the stormy seas.
meanings.sent2: The sailors preferred the weatherly boat for their ocean voyage.
meanings.sent3: The weatherly yacht outran the storm clouds, much to the crew's relief.
meanings.sent4: Her weatherly skills in sailing were unmatched, like a captain of the elements.
meanings.sent5: The weatherly vessel danced gracefully with the changing winds, a true master of the sea.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the ability of a vessel to perform well in different weather conditions.
meanings.sent1: The weatherly ship smoothly adjusted to the changing winds.
meanings.sent2: The captain praised the weatherly qualities of the boat during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The weatherly craft seemed to wink at the storm clouds, as if daring them to try harder.
meanings.sent4: Her weatherly performance in the race was like poetry in motion, a true marvel to behold.
meanings.sent5: The weatherly nature of the ship was its greatest strength, a reliable companion in any storm.
